::Axis/Lokk::

Lokk reaches the control panel, and shuts off the boosters and 
grabs onto the edges of the control center. Axis grabs the cieling 
handles as the craft slows down. Lokk looks at the small disply, 
then looks out the window of the craft. "Uhh, guys, something tells 
me that this planet," he points a hologram of Akaron 4, a grey and 
mostly void of life exile planet that they were supposed to be 
heading to, "isn't the one out side in front of us," He lowers his 
hand, and stares out the window at a magnificent colourful planet 
with frosty pure white spears and twirls of water vapour, so much 
deep blue that it envelopes the optics, massive earthy continents, 
and, he noticed a light show (CF battle) down near what looked like 
the tip a large continent. "Hey guys, look there," he points to the 
battle at the CF unknowingly."Seekker, Axis, take a look at that!"


On 22 Apr 2001, at 7:49, gunthers8@... wrote:

> ::Seekker::
> Seeker also forces his way with Lokk.
> "hehe...dumb bot...ha..ahaha..."
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "rAuq" <rauq@t...> wrote:
> > ::???/???::
> > 
> > Three bots look out the veiw ports of their ship. The larger of the 
> > three moves away from the veiw port, and looks at the controls of 
> > their ship, "Uhhh, which one is the steering thingy?" He looks at 
> > several buttons, and a couple other switches and possible control 
> > sticks. He decides to choose, as one of the other bots at the veiw 
> > port. "Lokk, what about this o--" He is interupted Lokk 
> yells, "AXIS, 
> > NOT THA--" Then Lokk is also interupted as one of the buttons is 
> > pressed by Axis. Lokk finishes his sentence as he is thrown 
> > backwards into the back wall of their ship, "Not the boost jets..." 
> > He hits the wall along with the other bots. and slides to the 
> floor. 
> > "Unghh... Axis," He turns his head slowly as the small group 
> > speeds forward in their small obsolete craft, "do NOT press any 
> > more buttons..." He spots the third bot, "Seekker, we've got to 
> > keep an eye on him and stop him before me messes up again," 
> > Lokk laughs lightly, "Now we gotta fix this piece of slag. C'mon 
> > Seekker," he strugles against the opposite force, towards the 
> > control panel.
>
